item.title: City of Joondalup councillor Nige Jones cautioned after claiming strip club drink as council travel expense
item.description: A local councillor who tried to get reimbursed for a drink he bought at "the best strip club in Australia" during a work trip describes the incident as a "genuine mistake".

item.title: Tasmania defeats NSW by an innings for first Sheffield Shield win, Sam Konstas out for 19 in second innings
item.description: Former Australia batters Sam Konstas and Kurtis Patterson have been dismissed cheaply in NSW's crushing innings and 58-run Sheffield Shield defeat to Tasmania.

item.title: Michelle Heyman 'uncomfortable' with missing ALW matches to play for Matildas
item.description: Michelle Heyman is 'uncomfortable' with the A-League Women continuing without international players as the Matildas prepare for their last matches before the AFC Women's Asian Cup.

item.title: Clean-up bill for asbestos scare at SA schools tipped to exceed $1.5m
item.description: SA's Minister for Education, Blair Boyer, is calling on retailers to help pay the climbing clean-up bill for removing coloured sand products linked to the asbestos scare.

item.title: Government plans to force tech giants pay for news
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Japan scrambles jets after suspected Chinese drone spotted near Yonaguni island near Taiwan
item.description: The incident comes amid an ongoing diplomatic spat between Tokyo and Beijing.

item.title: Trump orders peace envoy to meet Putin in Moscow to progress Ukraine plan
item.description: Donald Trump says he has instructed his special envoy, Steve Witkoff, to meet Vladimir Putin in Moscow to discuss a "fine-tuned" peace plan for Ukraine.

item.title: FBI to interview Democrats who urged US military to ignore illegal orders
item.description: It comes after the six US politicians appeared in a social media video that Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth described as "seditious".

item.title: How a daughter's 'puzzle' inspired the Polaroid camera and the 'instant photo'
item.description: On November 26, 1948, the first Polaroid camera was released commercially, changing photography forever.

item.title: Do you know fact from fiction in the world of forensic science?
item.description: Forensics has provided the biggest breakthrough in criminal justice in the last century. It's also become the perfect subject matter for TV crime shows. But do you know forensic facts from fiction? Take our quiz to find out.

item.title: Scammers and dodgy middlemen sell Indonesians a way to win 'war' for an Australian visa
item.description: Thousands of young Indonesians want the chance to come to Australia to work, but first they have to win a visa application "war" that puts them in the sights of scammers and dodgy operators promising them what they want — for a price.

item.title: Coalition makes tax cut pitch to young in bid to restore lost credibility among voters
item.description: Shadow Treasurer Ted O'Brien will address the National Press Club on Wednesday.

item.title: Women's Asian Cup underdogs India a 'realistic' chance to qualify for World Cup, coach says
item.description: Ranked 63rd in the world, India will need to finish ahead of Japan, Vietnam and Chinese Taipei to progress through next year's Women's Asian Cup and have a chance at their first-ever World Cup qualification.

item.title: Researchers discover rare blooming flower in Sumatran rainforest
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: A 13-year search for one of the world's rarest flowers in Indonesia ends in a 'magical experience'
item.description: A team of researchers describe the "magical" experience of finding a rare species of flower in bloom deep in the Sumatran rainforest after a 23-hour trek.

item.title: Pope Francis's Popemobile transformed into mobile clinic for Gaza children
item.description: A former "Popemobile" used by Pope Francis during his 2014 tour of the Holy Land has been transformed into a mobile health clinic for Gaza's children, but Israeli authorities are yet to give permission for it to enter the war-ravaged strip.

item.title: TGA says some vitamin B6 to be removed, prescriptions needed after toxicity cases
item.description: After a rising number of Australians reported suffering from B6 toxicity, the TGA has been forced to act and remove some supplements from shelves.

item.title: APY Lands community members disappointed after delay into hearing on governance
item.description: Anangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara (APY) Lands community members have been left disappointed by a last-minute decision to halt a hearing that was set to probe governance issues in the region.

item.title: Australia's east to get extreme weather with heat, winds and catastrophic fire danger
item.description: Eastern Australia is facing a barrage of extreme weather conditions this week, and for many areas the most intense conditions will arrive today.

item.title: Lurker explores fans, obsession and modern fame
item.description: In a world where celebrities are accessible on social media in a way they never were before, has fame lost its shine? A new film explores the parasitic relationship between stars and their fans.

item.title: Concerns for pollination industry and beekeepers as varroa mite worsens across NSW
item.description: The cost of treating varroa mite in the beekeeping industry is flowing onto other food growers reliant on pollination.

item.title: Why tens of thousands of houses ready for construction can't proceed
item.description: Four years after buying a housing plot, the Websters' land is still vacant, without a water or sewer connection, and they have now been told to expect those services by 2028.

item.title: Community concerned over proposed Woodlawn waste-to-energy facility at Tarago near Canberra
item.description: Farmers near Tarago in southern New South Wales fear a proposed waste-to-energy incinerator could threaten their health and livelihoods.

item.title: Palestinians left without shelter after Gaza tent cities flood again
item.description: Heavy rain causes significant flooding in Gaza, with thousands of Palestinians living in tents bearing the brunt of the sudden burst of winter weather.

item.title: Storms to continue across Queensland in 'hot, humid, unsettled' weather
item.description: The south-east corner braces for severe storms for the third day in a row, while much of Queensland swelters under humid heatwave conditions.

item.title: Federal politics: MPs in the dark as lights switch off during Question Time — as it happened
item.description: Some MPs turned to their phone torch lights after the lights briefly turned off during Question Time.

item.title: Traditional owners travel to Darwin as fight over aquifer reaches NT Supreme Court
item.description: Dozens of Aboriginal Territorians from remote communities travelled to Darwin where they stand alongside Environment Centre NT in a bid to axe a controversial water allocation plan.

item.title: Heavy rain floods camp for displaced Palestinians in Gaza
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Scientists and Indigenous rangers partner up in trial restoration of Great Barrier Reef
item.description: From growing baby coral in floating pools to using Indigenous cultural knowledge, this trial hopes to regrow the Great Barrier Reef.

item.title: Strikers pip Heat in final-ball WBBL thriller to record six-wicket win
item.description: With scores ties before the last delivery of the match, the Adelaide Strikers pull off a tense victory over the struggling Brisbane Heat.

item.title: Schools close as hot weather and dangerous fire conditions forecast across NSW
item.description: Dozens of schools across NSW are forced to close as a combination of severe weather conditions creates dangerous fire conditions not seen in years.

item.title: Residents, developers, investors camp out to secure blocks of land in Broome
item.description: A number of people slept in front of a real estate office in Western Australia's far north on Monday night in an attempt to purchase a block of land.

item.title: Trump says Ukraine peace deal is ‘close’
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Central Queensland Fitzroy Resources coal mine sale secures 1,000 jobs
item.description: A newly formed Queensland company has taken over a majority shareholding in a Bowen Basin coal mine, securing 1,000 jobs.

item.title: Polystyrene boxes blown in high winds cause damage in Mango Hill
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo set to avoid World Cup ban as FIFA confirms draw shake-up
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo will likely avoid missing any Portugal matches at the men's World Cup, despite receiving a red card in a qualifier.

item.title: Invasive Species Council blames government for booming rabbit numbers
item.description: Landholders across Australia say rabbit numbers in some areas are at levels never seen before.

item.title: Why convenience stores along Fremantle cafe strip are the front line of WA's illegal tobacco trade
item.description: Convenience stores along the popular strip are scarcely stocked with chocolate bars and chewing gum but it's the merchandise under the counter that's really paying the rent.

item.title: Call for men to step up, more funding to help end family and domestic violence
item.description: Men and boys are being urged to play a part in changing the culture of violence against women and children, as the annual 16 Days in WA campaign began with a rally in the Perth CBD.

item.title: Voter study shows Coalition loses status as better economic manager
item.description: The results of Australia's most prominent election study show Peter Dutton was the least popular leader in four decades.

item.title: Experts urge minister to do more to support youth detainees after Banksia Hill disturbance
item.description: For most, the absence of youth detention from the headlines after years of chaos would have been an indication things were working well — but Monday's troubling disturbance shows just how much still needs to be done.

item.title: Zach Merrett gives up Bombers AFL captaincy after failed Hawks trade
item.description: Zach Merrett steps down as Essendon men's captain after his failed trade request to Hawthorn left his position untenable.

item.title: Mental Health beds at Hobart's Peacock Centre have been closed due to a rat infestation
item.description: A rat infestation has forced the temporary closure of Peacock House, one of Tasmania's few public inpatient mental health facilities.

item.title: Childlike or childish? How these artists are tapping into their inner child
item.description: Whether it's enormous puppets, interactive bunny installations or handmade ceramics, these artists are embracing joy, whimsy and silliness to help people connect to their inner child.

item.title: Family of deceased woman sues Geelong Hospital over alleged medical negligence
item.description: Court documents allege the hospital breached its duty of care while caring for Port Fairy woman Jennifer Buchanan.

item.title: First Nations people say the Darling Baaka River is sick. A report confirms it
item.description: For months, people in remote Indigenous communities have been reporting skin rashes after going in the water, and a report confirms something is wrong with the river.

item.title: Australians with dementia urged to revisit the past to slow illness' progression
item.description: Helena Popovic took her father on a trip home to Serbia after he was diagnosed with dementia and believes its reminiscence therapy slowed the condition's progress.

item.title: Melbourne's mayor welcomes greater police search powers but some MPs say it's overreach
item.description: Melbourne's CBD will become a designated area from this weekend for six months, giving police the power to search people and vehicles for prohibited weapons without a warrant.

item.title: Sydney same-sex marriage mural of Tony Abbott marrying himself painted over
item.description: Possibly the longest ever wedding ceremony is now over for former prime minister Tony Abbott, after Scott Marsh's mural was painted over.

item.title: Allegations NSW Premier Chris Minns took thousands of dollars from unnamed donors a decade ago referred to ICAC
item.description: The allegations are included in an affidavit by a former ALP state organiser, which was tendered during a secret hearing of a parliamentary inquiry.

item.title: Matildas prepare to face New Zealand with one eye on 2026 Asian Cup
item.description: Ahead of two friendlies against their trans-Tasman rivals, the Matildas are mindful they cannot waste any time in the build-up to next year's Asian Cup.

item.title: UN AIDS body says Trump's foreign aid cuts have killed people and left millions without medicine
item.description: The United Nations body charged with fighting the spread of HIV says the Trump administration's cuts to the US foreign aid budget have sent the global aid response into "crisis mode".

item.title: Millennials are the first generation to move left as they age, rewriting the rules of Australian politics
item.description: Millennials are bucking trends, becoming an increasingly progressive voting bloc and rewriting the long-held rules of politics, writes Isabella Higgins.

item.title: Property affordability crisis triggers surge in outback NSW land values
item.description: The combined value of land in NSW passes $3 trillion for the first time, as the affordability crisis sees property prices skyrocket in remote towns.

item.title: Australia slips down Lowy Institute Asia Power Index that's still dominated by US and China
item.description: The latest Asia Power Index shows Australia slipping behind Russia for influence, while the region remains dominated by the US and China.

item.title: Robert Irwin wins Dancing with the Stars — a decade after sister Bindi
item.description: The son of late wildlife conservationist Steve Irwin wins Dancing with the Stars US, lifting the coveted Mirror Ball trophy a decade after his sister won the same title.

item.title: Man killed and 117,000 without power as storms lash Sydney and western NSW
item.description: A man has died after he was struck by a tree during a series of storms that have lashed New South Wales.

item.title: Outgoing Fringe director reflects on leading Australia's biggest arts festival
item.description: After returning from the UK to direct the Adelaide Fringe in 2015, Heather Croall has seen the festival's ticket sales pass the 3-million mark and box office sales reach nearly $30 million.

item.title: Government planning crackdown on perpetrators of economic abuse estimated to cost nearly $11b a year
item.description: The federal government is consulting on major reforms to reduce financial abuse, including making it harder for directors to be appointed without clear consent. Economic abuse is estimated to cost the economy nearly $11 billion a year

item.title: How Amanda's ex used technology to gaslight and abuse her
item.description: Amanda's husband always seemed to just know things. When fiddling around with her social media settings, she discovered how he had been using technology to gaslight her.

item.title: One year on from a landmark inquest, advocates say the NT's domestic violence crisis is worsening
item.description: A year after NT Coroner Elisabeth Armitage handed down 35 recommendations from a landmark domestic violence inquest, those on the frontline say things are going backwards.

item.title: Operation Topaz investigators uncover $25m owed to ATO amid worker exploitation probe
item.description: An investigation into farms and labour hire businesses in Queensland's agricultural heartland have uncovered $25 million in unpaid taxes, according to federal authorities.

item.title: Sunshine Coast Council backflips on decision to scrap New Year's Eve midnight fireworks
item.description: The Sunshine Coast Council has caved to public pressure and will resurrect its Mooloolaba midnight fireworks display, bringing the region into line with other Queensland towns.

item.title: Federal police union warns Labor 'austerity' drive would undermine security
item.description: An apparent request across the public service to find and suspend low-priority spending would undermine security if applied to the AFP, according to its union.

item.title: King Edward Memorial Hospital baby death leaves parents Alana and Paul Starkie seeking answers
item.description: A WA family has been devastated by the death of their newborn son at Perth's premier maternity hospital, and are desperate for answers on how the delivery of their fourth child went so tragically wrong.

item.title: Labor accused in Senate of turning blind eye to Nauru corruption allegations
item.description: Greens senator David Shoebridge reads what he alleges to be extracts from a secret AUSTRAC report that has not been made public, in the Senate late on Tuesday.

item.title: Social media age ban faces High Court challenge as government declares it will not be 'intimidated' by legal threats
item.description: Australia's social media age ban is being challenged in the High Court on the grounds that it restricts young teens' implied right to freedom of political communication.

item.title: Wallabies Test match fixtures for 2026 released, Les Kiss faces Eddie Jones in first match as coach of Australia
item.description: Incoming Wallabies coach Les Kiss will launch his tenure against Eddie Jones's Japan, Australia's 14-Test schedule for 2026 shows.

item.title: ACCC warns of 'sophisticated' ghost stores ahead of Black Friday, Cyber Monday sales
item.description: With Australians expected to spend billions this Black Friday, the consumer watchdog is warning about a growing number of "ghost stores" targeting unsuspecting shoppers and posing as local businesses promising premium goods, when in reality they are shipping fast fashion from overseas.

item.title: Socceroos placed in second pot for FIFA Men's World Cup draw in United States
item.description: The Socceroos, by pot luck, have avoided some of the sport's strongest nations for the 2026 World Cup pool stage.

item.title: NACC chief executive apologises to parliament for inaccurate evidence
item.description: National Anti-Corruption Commission chief executive Philip Reed writes to parliament apologising for inaccuracies in evidence given during Senate estimates.

item.title: Crews restore Sydney train services after wild weather, 'normal timetable' expected
item.description: Sydney Trains says engineers worked through the night to inspect and rectify damage after severe weather brought down trees onto power lines, impacting energy supply to the network.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: South Africa defeat India by 408 runs in second Test match, win series 2-0
item.description: South Africa has clinched its first Test series win in India in 25 years with a crushing 408-run win in the second Test, claiming a 2-0 series sweep.

item.title: Melbourne Stars defeat Hobart Hurricanes by 37 runs in WBBL
item.description: The Melbourne Stars will carry solid momentum into Saturday's big WBBL local derby, easily beating top side Hobart by 37 runs.

item.title: Man accused of international student's murder 'likely' had intellectual disability, court hears
item.description: A neuropsychologist has told the Northern Territory Supreme Court a man accused of murdering an international student in Darwin "likely" had an intellectual disability that impacted his ability to exercise self-control.

item.title: US National Parks to raise fees for millions of international tourists to popular sites
item.description: Changes set to take effect on January 1 will include annual park passes jumping to $US250 for foreign tourists, while US residents will continue to be charged $US80, according to authorities.

item.title: Scores of people killed as Hong Kong's worst fire in years engulfs high-rise complex
item.description: Fires that have burnt through the night are yet to be extinguished as firefighters struggle to reach those in need.

item.title: Donald Trump defends Ukraine envoy Steve Witkoff after leak alleging he advised Kremlin aide
item.description: It comes as a senior Kremlin official confirms Steve Witkoff is set to visit Moscow next week as efforts to find a consensus on ending the nearly four-year war between Russia and Ukraine pick up speed.

item.title: Israel launches new military operation in northern West Bank
item.description: Israeli security forces have launched what the military described as a counter-terrorism operation in the northern West Bank, which Palestinians said was targeting the city of Tubas.

item.title: The sound of a Martian dust devil
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Prawns, sneakers and spices: What we know about Indonesia's radioactive exports
item.description: Authorities in the US and Europe have recalled goods as Indonesian authorities investigate the source of radioactive contamination.

item.title: Judge dismisses 2020 election interference case against Donald Trump
item.description: The abandonment of the Georgia case is the latest reflection of how the US president has emerged largely unscathed from a spate of prosecutions that once threatened to imperil his political career.

item.title: Labor is celebrating a successful year but tough budget choices lie ahead
item.description: The level of the prime minister's reform appetite has been discussed and debated since roughly 9pm on election night in May, when Labor's massive win became clear.

item.title: Kangaroos player Ash Riddell has entire school behind her ahead of Saturday's AFLW grand final
item.description: Roos star — and grade 6 teacher — Ash Riddell has an entire school behind her ahead of this Saturday's AFLW grand final.

item.title: Australian music quiz: Test your knowledge of iconic Aussie acts
item.description: Celebrate Ausmusic T-Shirt Day with our Australian music trivia quiz. How well do you know your local legends?

item.title: Fire engulfs high-rise apartment buildings in Hong Kong
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Donald Trump is a 'master of dominating the news' and spotting his distractions can be difficult
item.description: What does a dead cat have to do with Donald Trump and the Epstein files? Everything, according to some experts.

item.title: Black Friday puts 'social pressure' on shoppers as more Australians rack up credit card debt
item.description: With millions of Australians tipped to spend record amounts this Black Friday, the value of personal credit and charge-card balances accruing interest has hit its highest level since 2021.

item.title: London Broncos rugby league hopes buoyed by Brisbane icon Darren Lockyer and players from PNG
item.description: The London Broncos might be the only rugby league club in Britain to have experienced relegation before a season even began — and Darren Lockyer, through the help of PNG Players, is hoping to bring them back.

item.title: 'Nudify' services used by Australian school students blocked after eSafety compliance action
item.description: The platforms, which can be used to make real people appear nude in photos and videos, have been used in several high-profile cases in Australian schools.

item.title: Guinea-Bissau military seizes control and arrests president and opposition leader
item.description: Guinea-Bissau's military says it has seized control of the country and arrested its president following the discovery of a plan to destabilise the coup-prone west African nation.

item.title: Rockliff's premiership tied to proposed stadium, but his is not the first to push a contentious project
item.description: With the vote to decide the fate of the Hobart stadium a week away, Premier Jeremy Rockliff's political legacy is in the balance.

item.title: NSW deputy coroner to decide if teen's death was caused by meat allergy from tick bites
item.description: Jeremy Webb died aged 16 after eating sausages while camping in the Central Coast. Growing up, he was bitten by ticks outdoors multiple times.

item.title: Optus and other telcos 'not meeting needs' of people with complaints over network issues: ombudsman
item.description: Optus has been under intense scrutiny after a network outage in September left hundreds of people unable to call Triple Zero and was linked to three deaths.

item.title: Queensland Premier David Crisafulli faces a political test on his home turf in Hinchinbrook by-election
item.description: If the electorate were to vote strongly against the government, it would sting first-term leader David Crisafulli and be spun as a rejection of the LNP's agenda, writes Alex Brewster.

item.title: Here is what we know about Hong Kong's Tai Po fire and the role of bamboo scaffolding
item.description: The blaze in Tai Po that engulfed multiple high-rise apartment blocks is still burning, and authorities say it likely began in bamboo scaffolding that encased the buildings.

item.title: Death toll rises to 55 as Hong Kong blaze continues to burn, three arrested
item.description: A massive high-rise apartment fire in Hong Kong's Tai Po district has killed at least 55 people and left hundreds more missing, with firefighters continuing to battle the blaze — as it happened.

item.title: Cricket and hockey among sports in contention to return for 2030 Commonwealth Games in India
item.description: Australia is expecting to see its medal chances boosted at the 2030 Commonwealth Games in Ahmedabad as sports such as cricket and hockey remain in contention to return.

item.title: Mother calls for new age limits after 8yo son killed in e-motorcycle crash
item.description: Kloe Weedon's son Zeke William Hondow, a schoolboy with a sharp wit and even sharper haircuts, was farewelled at a funeral last week.

item.title: Two National Guard members shot near White House in Washington DC
item.description: Authorities say the soldiers were ambushed by a lone gunman while on patrol in Washington, DC, as part of a Trump-ordered crime crackdown.

item.title: Federal politics: Barnaby Joyce quits the Nationals, Labor grilled on power prices in final Question Time of the year — as it happened
item.description: Former deputy prime minister Barnaby Joyce quits the Nationals. Meanwhile, Labor is grilled on power prices in the final Question Time of 2025.

item.title: Kotoni Staggs will continue to represent Kangaroos if Kevin Walters remains coach
item.description: Kotoni Staggs must decide between representing Australia or Tonga at the international level, and says there is one key factor that will tip his decision either way.

item.title: TagEnergy Naracoorte big battery project raises concerns about take-up of agricultural land
item.description: One of Australia's largest battery energy storage systems would be built on farmland in South Australia's south-east in a proposal that the developer says will lower electricity costs.

item.title: Queensland potato farmers help fill supply gap as southern drought causes national shortage
item.description: Potato growers in Queensland's far north are suddenly in hot demand as drought-stricken paddocks in the country's south fail to deliver.

item.title: ASX rises as Wall St rally continues, APRA to impose home loan limits — as it happened
item.description: The Australian banking regulator will impose limits on large home loans from February, while the ASX rises as Wall Street extended a recent recovery. See how the trading day unfolded on our live blog.

item.title: Thousands still without power in Western Sydney as outages plague business owners
item.description: Thousands of residents in Western Sydney are waking up without power and some schools across NSW will be closed after freak storms on Wednesday.

item.title: Global miner BMA drops Queensland mine expansion plan after a decade of environmental checks
item.description: An environmental impact statement found the project site would clear 136 hectares of koala habitat and significantly affect 33.55 hectares supporting greater glider populations.

item.title: Suicide Prevention Australia issues report linking adverse childhood experiences with suicide risk
item.description: Suicide Prevention Australia says there's an "urgent" need for action to stop the "significant and lasting" impact of childhood trauma.

item.title: Labor strikes deal with Greens to end environmental reform stalemate
item.description: The years-long stalemate over reforms to environmental laws is set to clear in the final week of the parliamentary year.

item.title: Varroa mite detected in bee hives at Sellicks Hill and Taratap
item.description: Beekeepers are being urged to monitor their hives more frequently after further detections of the deadly bee parasite varroa mite in South Australia.

item.title: An area near the White House was locked down after the shooting.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Used needle thrown into backyard 'horrifies' Karratha mother
item.description: A mother is in disbelief after a needle she believes was used to inject drugs was thrown into her Karratha backyard, where her toddler loves to play.

item.title: Matt Renshaw calls under-fire Usman Khawaja one of Australia's best-ever cricketers
item.description: Matt Renshaw is gunning for a spot in Australia's Test side, but does not want it to come at the expense of Australia's veteran opener Usman Khawaja just yet.

item.title: Woman killed and man injured in shark attack at Crowdy Bay on NSW Mid North Coast
item.description: One woman is dead and a man is in a critical condition after a shark attack at Crowdy Bay on the NSW Mid North Coast.

item.title: Liverpool in worst slump since 1953 after PSV thumping as Arsenal tops Champions League table
item.description: Liverpool's nightmare run of form continues after being humbled at home once again as Arsenal flexes its muscles in a heavyweight clash to go top of the Champions League.

item.title: Ballarat Gold Mine operators charged over 2024 rockfall that killed miner Kurt Hourigan
item.description: The operators of Ballarat Gold Mine have been charged over a rockfall that killed 37-year-old miner Kurt Hourigan and seriously injured a 21-year-old workmate in March 2024.

item.title: Floods leave at least 50 dead across Thailand, Indonesia and Malaysia
item.description: The Thai city of Hat Yai received its heaviest rainfall in 300 years, while mudslides killed dozens on the Indonesian island of Sumatra.

item.title: Banking regulator APRA to impose home loan caps amid housing boom
item.description: The banking regulator will impose restrictions on home loans from early next year to limit the number of "high-risk" large loans being issued to customers, which could have flow on effects in the housing market.

item.title: Isolation risks of Australia's social media ban for regional, rural and remote boarding school students
item.description: Regional and remote students are being encouraged to learn old-school ways to stay in contact as social media bans for those under 16 come into effect over the summer holidays.

item.title: Victoria faces risky summer with bushfire potential fuelled by spring grass growth
item.description: Dry conditions dogging Victoria put the state at a high risk of bushfires this summer, according to the latest summer fire outlook.

item.title: Hotter than average summer forecast as fire authorities warn of 'highly flammable' conditions
item.description: An increased risk of bushfire is expected for parts of the country this summer, with most areas expecting hotter than normal temperatures.

item.title: From Tehran to Roma: First permanent psychiatrist appointed in south-west Queensland
item.description: Farzin Rezaei has made the move from the Tehran University of Medical Sciences to the vast plains of south-west Queensland.

item.title: Labor and Greens agree on extra ABC funding for kids' programs
item.description: A deal between the federal government and the minor party will see an extra $50 million go to the public broadcaster to facilitate passage of a bill to impose local content requirements on streaming platforms.

item.title: Drone vision shows the Hong Kong towers continuing to burn.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: White wine grape oversupply 'another kick in the guts' for growers already in crisis
item.description: The wine grape industry has written to the SA government pleading for help as it reaches breaking point after indicative pricing for the next vintage is released showing growers could face losses of up to $270 per tonne.

item.title: Government projected to badly miss 2035 climate target, fall shy of 2030
item.description: The Environment Department projects Australia is expected to fall well short of its commitment to cut emissions by 62 to 70 per cent by 2035 — though the minister notes that is before accounting for a number of recent commitments.

item.title: ICC rates Perth pitch 'very good' despite two-day finish, putting spotlight on England's poor batting
item.description: Suggestions the pitch at Perth Stadium was not up to scratch for the first Ashes Test have been well and truly put to bed as the ICC hands down its assessment of the playing surface.

item.title: A new war looms one year on from the Israel-Lebanon ceasefire
item.description: One year after Israel and Hezbollah agreed to a ceasefire, the IDF is bombing Beirut again. And Israel has promised its latest strike will not be the last unless Lebanon's government does more to disarm Hezbollah.

item.title: Coroner releases findings into murder of Lilie James at Sydney school
item.description: A NSW coroner has urged young people to consider their use of location-sharing technology after the "senseless" murder of Lilie James at the hands of her ex-boyfriend.

item.title: Motherly love produces sweet jujube crop for grower near regional Victorian city of Mildura
item.description: Jujubes are a relatively unknown fruit for most Australians, but the sweet fruit has strong domestic demand for those looking for a taste of home.

item.title: Why housing, renewables and mining projects may speed up under new environment laws
item.description: Major housing, renewables and mining projects often get bogged down for years by Australia's aging environment laws. Now a deal to rewrite them could change that.

item.title: Second company confirms asbestos present in imported lift brake pads at wind farm
item.description: A second renewable energy provider says it is taking "immediate action" after the discovery of asbestos in imported brake pads used on access lifts at its wind farms around the country.

item.title: Jai Opetaia's opponent Huseyin Cinkara vows to knock him 'senseless' in Gold Coast title fight
item.description: Jai Opetaia's next opponent, Germany's Huseyin Cinkara, believes he has the power it takes to defeat the Australian world cruiserweight champion when they meet in the Gold Coast.

item.title: Why did Donald Trump send US National Guard troops to Washington DC in August?
item.description: The two US National Guard soldiers who were shot in Washington were among more than 2,000 troops deployed to the US capital.

item.title: Italy votes to make femicide a crime after series of killings and violence against women
item.description: Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni says the measure will help "defend the freedom and dignity of every woman", following a series of killings and other violence targeting women in Italy.

item.title: Future of Tasmania's foresty industry uncertain as Labor, Greens agree on environmental reform
item.description: The government has struck a deal with the Greens to overhaul Australia environmental laws, sparking concerns for the future of Tasmania's native logging industry.

item.title: Bali governor demands demolition of glass lift at Kelingking Beach in Nusa Penida
item.description: A controversial glass elevator at one of Bali's most picturesque beaches will have to be dismantled, with authorities citing planning violations.

item.title: Court hears murder of Steven and Min Cho 'utterly destroyed' lives of their family
item.description: An emotional court hearing has been told the pain felt by the family of Min and Steven Cho after they were killed by a martial arts instructor almost two years ago.

item.title: WA Premier Roger Cook says he has "industrial fomo"
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Roger Cook declares he has 'industrial FOMO' as Law Society slams powerful development laws
item.description: Roger Cook declares he has "industrial FOMO" and wants to take every opportunity to bring big projects to the state, as WA's peak legal body slams proposed new laws aimed at fast-tracking development.

item.title: Barnaby Joyce announces resignation from National Party
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Queensland Health imposes three month closures on illegal tobacco stores after statewide raids
item.description: Dozens of stores across every corner of the state have been closed for three months as officers exercise new powers passed in Queensland's parliament last week.

item.title: Kimberley man jailed for five years over 'brutal' attack on heavily pregnant woman
item.description: A Kimberley man has been sentenced to five years in jail after attacking a pregnant woman, forcing her to have an emergency caesarean.

item.title: Hong Kong inferno puts spotlight on risks of bamboo scaffolding
item.description: Hong Kong's deadliest fire in three decades draws attention to its risky use of flammable bamboo scaffolding and mesh for building work, in a tradition dating back centuries.

item.title: Head of Queensland child safety inquiry flags subpoena as department accused of ignoring law
item.description: The head of Queensland's child safety inquiry says he "might need to subpoena" files from the department after hearing it was often "not" following its own legislation around preferred permanency options for children in care.

item.title: From harried mums to high-stakes magic here are November's best movies
item.description: November saw the return of two beloved franchises; magic-filled Now You See Me and action classic Predator — but can either live up to their predecessors?

item.title: Community legal service warns more women enduring domestic violence being turned away
item.description: A community legal service gave Daisy the help she needed after she returned home to find her children gone — but she is one of the lucky ones, and there's a warning things are getting worse.

item.title: United States says it has stopped processing all immigration requests from Afghan nationals
item.description: The decision comes hours after US President Donald Trump said he was confident the suspect behind the shooting of two National Guard soldiers in Washington was from Afghanistan.

item.title: Temperatures soar across south-east Queensland as heatwave and humidity intensify
item.description: After days of relentless heat and storms, temperatures have jumped sharply again today.

item.title: Barnaby Joyce quits Nationals, will sit as independent
item.description: The former leader and deputy prime minister has confirmed his long-awaited political move.

item.title: Artificial reefs to be installed in Queensland's Great Sandy Marine Park
item.description: Claims new artificial reefs being installed in a protected marine park could damage a vulnerable natural coral reef are disputed by Queensland's environment minister.

item.title: How families tracked victims and survivors in real time during Hong Kong's Tai Po tower fire
item.description: When a fatal fire tore through seven high-rise towers in Hong Kong's Tai Po district, thousands of families were glued to a single webpage that offered updates far more quickly than official government briefings.

item.title: Joyce exits, Turnbull returns as Ghosts of Christmas Past haunt parliament
item.description: In the end, it turns out not even a Wagyu steak from Gina Rinehart's cattle company cooked on a sandwich press was enough to lock in Barnaby Joyce's defection to One Nation.

item.title: James Anderson expects England to pick same side for second Ashes Test
item.description: England are unlikely to tinker with their side for the second Ashes Test against Australia starting in Brisbane next week despite being thumped in the opening match, former fast bowler James Anderson has said.

item.title: Australian PGA Championships round one cut short by storms, with Spain's Sebastian Garcia in the lead
item.description: In-form Spaniard Sebastian Garcia shoots three strokes clear of a big-name leaderboard before Brisbane's storms halt his first-round charge.

item.title: New Zealand launches inquiry into case of father who hid his children in a forest for years
item.description: Tom Phillips disappeared with his children in late 2021, in a case that drew global attention for his ability to evade arrest.

item.title: Dead fish, foam seen on metro beaches despite overall low Karenia algal levels
item.description: Authorities say metropolitan testing shows Karenia algal levels remain low compared with last month, despite thick foam and fish deaths seen on some beaches in recent days.

item.title: With a deal on Australia's environmental laws, Murray Watt has cemented his reputation as a 'fixer'
item.description: In his deal with the Greens, Environment Minister Murray Watt has just scraped off one of the biggest barnacles clinging to parliament.

item.title: Neuropsychologist in 'emphatic' disagreement over whether alleged murderer had substantial mental impairment
item.description: A neuropsychologist tells the court an NT man accused of murdering an international student was not suffering from a substantial mental impairment at the time of the alleged crime.

item.title: Breeding stallion St Jean, sire of Melbourne Cup winner Half Yours, dies after collision with fence post
item.description: Stud operators mourn the death of "beloved" stallion St Jean — whose son Half Yours won the Melbourne and Caulfield Cups — after breaking his leg in a paddock accident.

item.title: Thursday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Coroner releases findings into murder of Lilie James
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Hong Kong fire kills at least 83, hundreds still missing as firefighters continue to battle blaze
item.description: Authorities say the apartment complex blaze may have been caused by a "grossly negligent" construction firm using unsafe materials. Three men have been arrested on suspicion of manslaughter.

item.title: Berkeley River Lodge caretakers survived 'apocalyptic' Cyclone Fina in underground bunker
item.description: Laura Stokes and Adam Zerna describe spending time in an underground bunker as the category three cyclone passed over, before emerging to find an "apocalyptic" scene.

item.title: NT rams through changes to Banned Drinker Register amid parliamentary debate on scrutiny
item.description: In the final hours of parliament for the year, the government has extended the time a person issued with a Banned Drinker Order is prevented from drinking alcohol.

item.title: Correspondent James Oaten in Hong Kong
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Iran condemns Australia's listing of IRGC as sponsor of terrorism as 'offensive and unjustified'
item.description: The Iranian Government has condemned Australia's formal listing of its Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) as a state sponsor of terrorism as "offensive and unjustified", accusing the Albanese government of doing Israel's bidding.

item.title: Putin says US plan could be 'basis' for end to Ukraine war, but threatens to take land
item.description: Vladimir Putin suggests he is open to developing a new agreement, but says Russia will continue fighting if no deal is struck.

item.title: Troops critically injured in Washington shooting named as FBI launches terror probe
item.description: Authorities identify the two National Guard members shot just blocks from the White House, as the FBI carries out searches of two properties on the US west coast.

item.title: The ABC's explosive childcare investigations began with an email
item.description: This story is about something deeper than policy or profit. It's about the trust parents place in childcare every morning when they hand over their children, believing they will be safe — only to find they're not.

item.title: Student paramedic wins battle with Ambulance Victoria over beard policy
item.description: A student paramedic who accused Ambulance Victoria of discrimination on the grounds of race and religion is "ecstatic" to have won his battle to allow cultural beards on the job.

item.title: Patrick Lee Brown sentenced to three years in prison over 'inexcusable' Tasmanian car chases
item.description: During sentencing, a Supreme Court Justice told Patrick Lee Brown he "completely disregarded the safety of anyone else" during two different police pursuits, including one in a stolen rental truck with blown-out tyres.

item.title: Macquarie Point stadium planning panel tells parliament of ongoing concerns a week from crucial vote
item.description: An expert planning panel has defended their scathing assessment of Hobart's proposed Macquarie Point stadium while speaking to the politicians who will ultimately decide the project's fate.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: The G20 summit, a cyclone and a very famous pub
item.description: Think you’ve had your ears to the ground? It’s time to test your knowledge of the week that was.

item.title: Frozen rewrote the Disney princess narrative — and 12 years later, it's still relevant
item.description: It wasn't just a box office success — Frozen introduced a new type of Disney princess: one who was strong, flawed and uninterested in romance.

item.title: Hong Kong residents devastated by mega blaze engulfing blocks of flats in Tai Po district
item.description: Locals are in shock after fire destroyed apartment blocks home to thousands of people, as questions remain about the suitability of building materials and a lack of fire alarms.

item.title: Social media ban implementation will 'vary' across platforms, eSafety commissioner warns
item.description: Not all Australians aged under 16 will "magically disappear overnight" from social media, the nation's online safety regulator says, amid a legal challenge to pause the start of the federal government's ban.

item.title: Maduro sings Lennon's 'Imagine' during a rally with supporters
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: The flashpoints leading the US and Venezuela to the brink of a conflict decades in the making
item.description: Tensions between Donald Trump and Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro Moros have been escalating after months of launching lethal air strikes on vessels accused of shipping deadly drugs north to the US.

item.title: Calls for states to change alcohol laws ahead of women’s ministers meeting
item.description: A major review into preventing violence against women and children called for changes to immediate alcohol home delivery

item.title: How to spot a scam during Black Friday and Cyber Monday
item.description: As scammers look to exploit sales during Black Friday and Cyber Monday, we explain what you need to know to avoid being duped.

item.title: Second storm of the year pushes tiny town of Nevertire to its limit
item.description: A storm that hit a tiny rural NSW town, damaging one in 10 homes, is psychologically draining for residents.

item.title: Gippsland V/Line free travel scheme leaves Victorians confused as commuters report mixed messages
item.description: A promised month of free travel on the Gippsland Line in Victoria's east prompts complaints from some passengers, with even a V/Line staff member unsure of how the system works.

item.title: Perth Scorchers defeat Melbourne Renegades by four wickets in WBBL clash at Junction Oval
item.description: Perth have survived a dramatic collapse to beat the Melbourne Renegades by four wickets, denying the Renegades a share of top spot on the WBBL ladder.

item.title: Video appears to show Israeli soldiers 'executing' two Palestinians in West Bank
item.description: Video has emerged appearing to show two Palestinians being 'executed' by Israeli forces in the West Bank, with the Israeli military saying it has launched an investigation into the incident.

item.title: Domestic violence survivors left 'deeply traumatised' in efforts to keep temporary accommodation access
item.description: Two women who fled their violent partners say their efforts to stay in emergency accommodation via state government housing offices left them "deeply traumatised".

item.title: One of Hong Kong's deadliest fires engulfed multiple high-rise towers in just hours
item.description: Hong Kong's deadliest fire in decades tore through a group of high-rise residential towers in a densely packed housing estate, causing major issues for firefighters. This is how the catastrophe unfolded.

item.title: Greens out-step flat-footed Liberals on crucial environmental deal
item.description: The environmental deal is a major win for a government whose critics on the left are calling for it to be more reformist.

item.title: Hot air balloons carry more risk than helicopters and light planes, report finds
item.description: Hot air balloon rides are nearly 10 times riskier than a joy flight in a light plane or a helicopter, a new report by the national transport safety investigator has found.

item.title: When Sydney's popular swimming spots will reopen as weather heats up
item.description: From 'Pondi' to Sydney Harbour, here's when your popular spots will reopen.

item.title: Cybersecurity experts raise concerns about Snapchat's age-verification methods
item.description: As the social media ban for kids under 16 approaches, popular messaging app Snapchat says young people will be able to verify their age by sending a selfie or their ID to a third-party platform, but sharing sensitive data carries risks.

item.title: Fatal shark attack triggers painful memories for past survivors
item.description: Shark attack survivors rally after a bull shark kills a woman and injures a man on the NSW mid north coast, warning of a nasty online backlash.

item.title: Queensland's 'promising' coercive control laws see more than 50 charges laid in six months since criminalisation
item.description: The standalone legislation — named in memory of Brisbane mother Hannah Clarke, who was murdered alongside her three children by her estranged husband in 2020 — came into effect in May.

item.title: Oscar Piastri dismisses helping McLaren teammate Lando Norris win F1 drivers' championship
item.description: Oscar Piastri says McLaren raised the prospect of the Australian helping his teammate Lando Norris win the Formula 1 world championship, but it was rejected.

item.title: Infrastructure installed to probe Coorong storm surges and groundwater impacts
item.description: Infrastructure to monitor the impact of rising sea levels and storm surges on the Coorong in South Australia has been installed along the thin strip of coastline between Goolwa Beach and the lagoons of the Ramsar-listed wetland.

item.title: Police arrest more people over violence at Melbourne CBD rally in October
item.description: Two men have been charged with assaulting police at a rally in Melbourne's CBD in October. The arrests come as police prepare for another demonstration in the city on Sunday.

item.title: Federal politics live: Nationals senator hopes party leader will entice Barnaby Joyce back
item.description: Nationals senator Matt Canavan says he will try to convince Barnaby Joyce to return to the National party after his departure yesterday. Follow live.

item.title: Melbourne protesters throw fruit, rocks, glass at police
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Cool weather sets cherry crops 'weeks' behind schedule in lead-up to Christmas
item.description: The latest casualty of a year with delayed crops has been the cherry, with cold weather in some growing regions setting the festive favourite 'weeks' behind schedule.
